intro: Orthilia obtusata, commonly known as the bluntleaf orthilia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are elliptical with a blunt tip, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
